messages.content:
Enterprise BPM Platform Implementation
Unified BPM platform for process automation and case management
Low-code, model-driven configuration with integration to existing systems
Comprehensive functional, technical, and security requirements
Three-year support and maintenance with defined SLAs
Evaluation based on fit, experience, approach, and total cost of ownership

{"key_requirements_summary": "Enterprise BPM Platform Implementation
Unified BPM platform for process automation and case management
Low-code, model-driven configuration with integration to existing systems
Comprehensive functional, technical, and security requirements
Three-year support and maintenance with defined SLAs
Evaluation based on fit, experience, approach, and total cost of ownership", "language": "en", "removed_text_length": 348, "cleaned_text_excerpt": "MINISTRY OF TRADE AND INDUSTRY (MTI) REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL (RFP) RFP No: MTI/BPM/2024/01
Implementation of an Enterprise Business Process Management (BPM) Platform

1. Introduction
The Ministry of Trade and Industry ("MTI" or "the Ministry") invites qualified vendors ("Bidders") to submit proposals for the supply, implementation, and ongoing support of an enterprise Business Process Management (BPM) platform. The solution will be used to automate, monitor, and continuously improve MTI’s core business processes and related workflows. This RFP outlines the Ministry’s requirements, expectations, and evaluation criteria. Bidders are required to submit comprehensive, well-structured responses in accordance with the instructions provided in this document.

2. Background
MTI is responsible for promoting sustainable economic growth, supporting businesses, facilitating trade, and encouraging investment. The Ministry currently operates multiple legacy systems and a number of manual, paper-based or email-driven processes for case handling, approvals, licensing, grants management, inspections, and stakeholder engagements. These fragmented processes lead to limited end-to-end visibility of cases and workloads, inconsistent application of business rules and policies, longer processing times, and high dependency on manual intervention. To address these challenges, MTI intends to implement a modern, model-driven BPM platform with strong capabilities for case management, workflow orchestration, rules management, and integration with existing systems.

3. Objectives
The key objectives of this RFP are to:
- Implement a unified BPM platform to orchestrate and manage core MTI business processes.
- Provide a configurable case management capability that supports both structured and unstructured work.
- Enforce consistent application of business rules, policy, and regulatory requirements.
- Improve transparency and auditability through end-to-end tracking of cases, tasks, and SLAs.
- Enable faster introduction of new services and process changes via low-code configuration.
- Provide user-friendly interfaces for staff, management, and external stakeholders.
- Lay the foundation for analytics and continuous process improvement.

4. Scope of Work
The successful Bidder will be required to deliver, at minimum, the following:

4.1 Solution Provisioning
- Provide an enterprise-grade BPM platform, licensed for MTI’s anticipated user base (internal and external users).
- Support both workbasket and worklist paradigms for task distribution and assignment.
- Provide role-based access control with integration to MTI’s identity management (e.g., Active Directory or equivalent).

4.2 Process Areas in Scope
The initial implementation will focus on, but is not limited to, the following processes:
- Business licensing and renewals.
- Incentive and grants application management.
- Trade facilitation case handling and approvals.
- Internal service requests (e.g., HR, Finance, IT service requests) as a shared services use case.
Bidders should design their solutions in a way that additional processes can be onboarded rapidly using configuration rather than custom code.

4.3 Implementation Services
- Requirements gathering and refinement in collaboration with MTI stakeholders.
- Process modelling and design using the proposed BPM platform.
- Design and implementation of user interfaces for different personas (case workers, supervisors, external users).
- Configuration of business rules, SLAs, escalations, and routing logic.
- Integration with existing systems such as document management, email, identity management, and core line-of-business systems.
- Data migration strategy (where applicable) from legacy systems or spreadsheets.
- System and integration testing, including performance and security testing.
- Support during user acceptance testing (UAT).

4.4 Reporting and Analytics
- Provide dashboards and reports for monitoring case volumes, workload distribution, SLA per"}

Enterprise BPM Platform Implementation
Unified BPM platform for process automation and case management
Low-code, model-driven configuration with integration to existing systems
Comprehensive functional, technical, and security requirements
Three-year support and maintenance with defined SLAs
Structured proposal format and evaluation based on fit, experience, and cost

{"key_requirements_summary": "Enterprise BPM Platform Implementation
Unified BPM platform for process automation and case management
Low-code, model-driven configuration with integration to existing systems
Comprehensive functional, technical, and security requirements
Three-year support and maintenance with defined SLAs
Structured proposal format and evaluation based on fit, experience, and cost", "language": "en", "removed_text_length": 348, "cleaned_text_excerpt": "MINISTRY OF TRADE AND INDUSTRY (MTI) REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL (RFP) RFP No: MTI/BPM/2024/01 Implementation of an Enterprise Business Process Management (BPM) Platform

1. Introduction
The Ministry of Trade and Industry ("MTI" or "the Ministry") invites qualified vendors ("Bidders") to submit proposals for the supply, implementation, and ongoing support of an enterprise Business Process Management (BPM) platform. The solution will be used to automate, monitor, and continuously improve MTI’s core business processes and related workflows. This RFP outlines the Ministry’s requirements, expectations, and evaluation criteria. Bidders are required to submit comprehensive, well-structured responses in accordance with the instructions provided in this document.

2. Background
MTI is responsible for promoting sustainable economic growth, supporting businesses, facilitating trade, and encouraging investment. The Ministry currently operates multiple legacy systems and a number of manual, paper-based or email-driven processes for case handling, approvals, licensing, grants management, inspections, and stakeholder engagements. These fragmented processes lead to limited end-to-end visibility of cases and workloads, inconsistent application of business rules and policies, longer processing times, and high dependency on manual intervention. To address these challenges, MTI intends to implement a modern, model-driven BPM platform with strong capabilities for case management, workflow orchestration, rules management, and integration with existing systems.

3. Objectives
The key objectives of this RFP are to:
- Implement a unified BPM platform to orchestrate and manage core MTI business processes.
- Provide a configurable case management capability that supports both structured and unstructured work.
- Enforce consistent application of business rules, policy, and regulatory requirements.
- Improve transparency and auditability through end-to-end tracking of cases, tasks, and SLAs.
- Enable faster introduction of new services and process changes via low-code configuration.
- Provide user-friendly interfaces for staff, management, and external stakeholders.
- Lay the foundation for analytics and continuous process improvement.

4. Scope of Work
The successful Bidder will be required to deliver, at minimum, the following:

4.1 Solution Provisioning
- Provide an enterprise-grade BPM platform, licensed for MTI’s anticipated user base (internal and external users).
- Support both workbasket and worklist paradigms for task distribution and assignment.
- Provide role-based access control with integration to MTI’s identity management (e.g., Active Directory or equivalent).

4.2 Process Areas in Scope
The initial implementation will focus on, but is not limited to, the following processes:
- Business licensing and renewals.
- Incentive and grants application management.
- Trade facilitation case handling and approvals.
- Internal service requests (e.g., HR, Finance, IT service requests) as a shared services use case.
Bidders should design their solutions in a way that additional processes can be onboarded rapidly using configuration rather than custom code.

4.3 Implementation Services
- Requirements gathering and refinement in collaboration with MTI stakeholders.
- Process modelling and design using the proposed BPM platform.
- Design and implementation of user interfaces for different personas (case workers, supervisors, external users).
- Configuration of business rules, SLAs, escalations, and routing logic.
- Integration with existing systems such as document management, email, identity management, and core line-of-business systems.
- Data migration strategy (where applicable) from legacy systems or spreadsheets.
- System and integration testing, including performance and security testing.
- Support during user acceptance testing (UAT).

4.4 Reporting and Analytics
- Provide dashboards and reports for monitoring case volumes, workload distribution, SLA per"}
RFP REQUIREMENTS SNAPSHOT

Bidders should design their solutions in a way that additional processes can be onboarded rapidly using configuration rather than custom code."}, {"id": "SR-3", "type": "unspecified", "category": "implementation_services", "source_text": "Requirements gathering and refinement in collaboration with MTI stakeholders. Process modelling and design using the proposed BPM platform. Design and implementation of user interfaces for different personas (case workers, supervisors, external users). Configuration of business rules, SLAs, escalations, and routing logic. Integration with existing systems such as document management, email, identity management, and core line-of-business systems. Data migration strategy (where applicable) from legacy systems or spreadsheets. System and integration testing, including performance and security testing. Support during user acceptance testing (UAT)."}, {"id": "SR-4", "type": "unspecified", "category": "reporting_analytics", "source_text": "Provide dashboards and reports for monitoring case volumes, workload distribution, SLA performance, and bottlenecks. Enable business users to create or modify standard reports and dashboards without extensive IT involvement. Provide an audit trail for all key process steps, decisions, and data changes."}, {"id": "SR-5", "type": "unspecified", "category": "training_change_management", "source_text": "Deliver training for system administrators, business power users, and end users. Provide training materials and user guides. Support MTI’s change management activities through workshops, knowledge transfer sessions, and documentation."}, {"id": "SR-6", "type": "unspecified", "category": "support_maintenance", "source_text": "Provide a minimum of three (3) years of post go-live support and maintenance, including patching, upgrades, and incident resolution. Define service level agreements (SLAs) for response and resolution times. Provide a clear escalation path and governance model for issue handling and enhancements."}, {"id": "SR-7", "type": "mandatory", "category": "functional_case_process_management", "source_text": "Support for both straight-through processing and human-centric workflows. Dynamic case management, including ad-hoc tasks, attachments, and notes. Configurable workqueues, routing and re-assignment rules, and workload balancing."}, {"id": "SR-8", "type": "mandatory", "category": "functional_business_rules", "source_text": "Centralised rules management to externalise business policies from application code. Versioning, testing, and controlled deployment of rules. Ability for authorised business users to update certain rules without vendor intervention (under governance)."}, {"id": "SR-9", "type": "mandatory", "category": "functional_user_experience", "source_text": "Web-based, responsive user interfaces accessible via standard browsers. Guided steps and contextual help for case workers. Self-service portals or forms for external users to submit applications and track status."}, {"id": "SR-10", "type": "mandatory", "category": "functional_sla_monitoring", "source_text": "Definition and monitoring of SLAs and performance targets per process and case type. Automated escalations, notifications, and reminders. Real-time dashboards for supervisors and management."}, {"id": "SR-11", "type": "mandatory", "category": "technical_architecture", "source_text": "Based on a proven, enterprise-grade BPM suite suitable for government and large enterprises. Low-code / model-driven configuration approach to minimise custom development. Support for deployment in MTI’s chosen environment (on-premises, cloud, or hybrid), to be specified in the Bidder’s response. High availability and scalability to support growth in users and transaction volumes."}, {"id": "SR-12", "type": "mandatory", "category": "technical_integration", "source_text": "Standard integration mechanisms (e.g., REST APIs, message queues, event-based integration). Secure integration with MTI’s identity management and single sign-on (SSO) infrastructure. Support for integration with existing document management and email systems."}, {"id": "SR-13", "type": "mandatory", "category": "technical_security_compliance", "source_text": "Role-based access control with fine-grained permissions. Full audit logging of key user actions and process changes. Compliance with relevant national data protection and cybersecurity regulations. Environment separation for development, testing, and production."}, {"id": "SR-14", "type": "mandatory", "category": "vendor_qualifications", "source_text": "Bidders must demonstrate: At least three (3) years of experience in implementing the proposed BPM platform. At least two (2) similar projects for government or large enterprises, preferably in trade, economic development, or related domains. Availability of certified consultants on the proposed platform (architects, developers, and business analysts). A strong local presence or partnership to ensure smooth implementation and support. Bidders must provide customer references, including project scope, duration, and outcomes."}], "response_structure_requirements": [{"id": "RSR-1", "type": "mandatory", "category": "proposal_structure", "source_text": "Bidders shall structure their proposals as follows:
1. Executive Summary.
2. Understanding of MTI’s Objectives and Context.
3. Proposed Solution Overview (architecture, major components, key differentiators).
4. Implementation Approach and Methodology.
5. Project Plan and Timelines, including major milestones.
6. Proposed Team Structure, roles, and CVs of key personnel.
7. Functional and Technical Compliance Matrix responding to the requirements in Sections 5 and 6.
8. Assumptions, Dependencies, and Risks, with proposed mitigation strategies.
9. Support and Maintenance Model, including SLAs.
10. Commercial Proposal (licensing, implementation services, support, and any optional components)."}, {"id": "RSR-2", "type": "mandatory", "category": "language_format", "source_text": "All proposals must be submitted in English. Proposals must be provided in both editable format and PDF. Bidders must strictly follow the structure listed above, clearly labelling each section and subsection."}, {"id": "RSR-3", "type": "mandatory", "category": "submission_instructions", "source_text": "Proposals must be submitted electronically via email with the subject line: "RFP Response MTI/BPM/2024/01". Bidders must ensure that their complete proposal is received before the submission deadline. Late submissions may be rejected without further consideration. All questions regarding this RFP must be submitted in writing by the deadline for questions."}], "notes": "All requirements were extracted verbatim from the RFP. Related items within the same paragraph or bullet group were kept together as single cohesive requirements per the extraction rules."}
RFP BUILD QUERY SNAPSHOT

Define service level agreements (SLAs) for response and resolution times. Provide a clear escalation path and governance model for issue handling and enhancements.

[SR-8] Centralised rules management to externalise business policies from application code. Versioning, testing, and controlled deployment of rules. Ability for authorised business users to update certain rules without vendor intervention (under governance).
[SR-9] Web-based, responsive user interfaces accessible via standard browsers. Guided steps and contextual help for case workers. Self-service portals or forms for external users to submit applications and track status.
[SR-10] Definition and monitoring of SLAs and performance targets per process and case type. Automated escalations, notifications, and reminders. Real-time dashboards for supervisors and management.
[SR-11] Based on a proven, enterprise-grade BPM suite suitable for government and large enterprises. Low-code / model-driven configuration approach to minimise custom development. Support for deployment in MTI’s chosen environment (on-premises, cloud, or hybrid), to be specified in the Bidder’s response. High availability and scalability to support growth in users and transaction volumes.
[SR-12] Standard integration mechanisms (e.g., REST APIs, message queues, event-based integration). Secure integration with MTI’s identity management and single sign-on (SSO) infrastructure. Support for integration with existing document management and email systems.
[SR-13] Role-based access control with fine-grained permissions. Full audit logging of key user actions and proc", "response_structure_requirements_summary": "[RSR-1] Bidders shall structure their proposals as follows:
1. Executive Summary.

10. Commercial Proposal (licensing, implementation services, support, and any optional components).
[RSR-2] All proposals must be submitted in English. Proposals must be provided in both editable format and PDF. Bidders must strictly follow the structure listed above, clearly labelling each section and subsection.
[RSR-3] Proposals must be submitted electronically via email with the subject line: "RFP Response MTI/BPM/2024/01". Bidders must ensure that their complete proposal is received before the submission deadline. Late submissions may be rejected without further consideration. All questions regarding this RFP must be submitted in writing by the deadline for questions.", "query_preview": "RFP RESPONSE GENERATION QUERY
================================================================================

SOLUTION REQUIREMENTS (What the buyer wants):
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[SR-1] Provide an enterprise-grade BPM platform, licensed for MTI’s anticipated user base (internal and external users). Support both workbasket and worklist paradigms for task distribution and assignment. Provide role-based access control with integration to MTI’s identity management (e.g., Active Directory or equivalent).
[SR-2] The initial implementation will focus on, but is not limited to, the following processes:
- Business licensing and renewals.
- Incentive and grants application management.
- Trade facilitation case handling and approvals.
- Internal service requests (e.g., HR, Finance, IT service requests) as a shared services use case.
Bidders should design their solutions in a way that additional processes can be onboarded rapidly using configuration rather than custom code.
[SR-3] Requirements gathering and refinement in collaboration with MTI stakeholders. Process modelling and design using the proposed BPM platform. Design and implementation of user interfaces for different personas (case workers, supervisors, external users). Configuration of business rules, SLAs, escalations, and routing logic. Integration with existing systems such as document management, email, identity management, and core line-of-business systems. Data migration strategy (where applicable) from legacy systems or spreadsheets. System and integration testing, including performance and security testing. Support during user acceptance testing (UAT).
[SR-4] Provide dashboards and reports for monitoring case volumes, workload distribution, SLA performance, and bottlenecks. Enable business users to create or modify standard reports and dashboards without extensive IT involvement. Provide an audit trail for all key process steps, decisions, and data changes.
[SR-5] Deliver training for system administrators, business power users, and end users. Provide training materials and user guides. Support MTI’s change management activities through workshops, knowledge transfer sessions, and documentation.
[SR-6] Provide a minimum of three (3) years of post go-live support and maintenance, including patching, upgrades, and incident resolution. Define service level agreements (SLAs) for response and resolution times. Provide a clear escalation path and governance model for issue handling and enhancements.
[SR-7] Support for both straight-through processing and human-centric workflows. Dynamic case management, including ad-hoc tasks, attachments, and notes. Configurable workqueues, routing and re-assignment rules, and workload balancing.
[SR-8] Centralised rules management to externalise business policies from application code. Versioning, testing, and controlled deployment of rules. Ability for authorised business users to update certain rules without vendor intervention (under governance).
[SR-9] Web-based, responsive user interfaces accessible via standard browsers. Guided steps and contextual help for case workers. Self-service portals or forms for external users to submit applications and track status.
[SR-10] Definition and monitoring of SLAs and performance targets per process and case type. Automated escalations, notifications, and reminders. Real-time dashboards for supervisors and management.
[SR-11] Based on a proven, enterprise-grade BPM suite suitable for government and large enterprises. Low-code / model-driven configuration approach to minimise custom development. Support for deployment in MTI’s chosen environment (on-premises, cloud, or hybrid), to be specified in the Bidder’s response. High availability and scalability to support growth in users and transaction volumes.
[SR-12] Standard integration mechanisms (e.g., REST APIs, message queues, event-based integration). Secure integration with MTI’s identity management and single sign-on (SSO) infrastructure. Support for integration with existing document management and email systems.
[SR-13] Role-based access control with fine-grained permissions. Full audit logging of key user actions and process changes. Compliance with relevant national data protection and cybersecurity regulations. Environment separation for development, testing, and production.
[SR-14] Bidders must demonstrate: At least three (3) years of experience in implementing the proposed BPM platform. At least two (2) similar projects for government or large enterprises, preferably in trade, economic development, or related domains. Availability of certified consultants on the proposed platform (architects, developers, and business analysts). A strong local presence or partnership to ensure smooth implementation and support. Bidders must provide customer references, including project scope, duration, and outcomes.

RESPONSE STRUCTURE REQUIREMENTS (How to respond):
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[RSR-1] Bidders shall structure their proposals as follows:
1. Executive Summary.
2. Understanding of MTI’s Objectives and Context.
3. Proposed Solution Overview (architecture, major components, key differentiators).
4. Implementation Approach and Methodology.
5. Project Plan and Timelines, including major milestones.
6. Proposed Team Structure, roles, and CVs of key personnel.
7. Functional and Technical Compliance Matrix responding to the requirements in Sections 5 and 6.
8. Assumptions, Dependencies, and Risks, with proposed mitigation strategies.
9. Support and Maintenance Model, including SLAs.
10. Commercial Proposal (licensing, implementation services, support, and any optional components).
[RSR-2] All proposals must be submitted in English. Proposals must be provided in both editable format and PDF. Bidders must strictly follow the structure listed above, clearly labelling each section and subsection.
[RSR-3] Proposals must be submitted electronically via email with the subject line: "RFP Response MTI/BPM/2024/01". Bidders must ensure that their complete proposal is received before the submission deadline. Late submissions may be rejected without further consideration. All questions regarding this RFP must be submitted in writing by the deadline for questions.

EXTRACTION DATA:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Language: en

KEY REQUIREMENTS SUMMARY:
Enterprise BPM Platform Implementation
Unified BPM platform for process automation and case management
Low-code, model-driven configuration with integration to existing systems
Comprehensive functional, technical, and security requirements
Three-year support and maintenance with defined SLAs
Structured proposal format and evaluation based on fit, experience, and cost"}

Enterprise BPM Platform Implementation
Unified BPM solution for process automation and case management
Low-code, model-driven configuration with integration to existing systems
Comprehensive functional, technical, and security requirements
Three-year support and maintenance with defined SLAs
Structured proposal format and evaluation based on fit, experience, and cost

4.3 Implementation Services

[SR-10] Definition and monitoring of SLAs and performance targets per process and case type. Automated escalations, notifications, and reminders. Real-time dashboards for supervisors and management.
[SR-11] Based on a proven, enterprise-grade BPM suite suitable for government and large enterprises. Low-code / model-driven configuration approach to minimise custom development. SOLUTION REQUIREMENTS (What the buyer wants):
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[SR-1] Provide an enterprise-grade BPM platform, licensed for MTI’s anticipated user base (internal and external users). Support both workbasket and worklist paradigms for task distribution and assignment. Provide role-based access control with integration to MTI’s identity management (e.g., Active Directory or equivalent).
[SR-2] The initial implementation will focus on, but is not limited to, the following processes:
- Business licensing and renewals.
- Incentive and grants application management.
- Trade facilitation case handling and approvals.
- Internal service requests (e.g., HR, Finance, IT service requests) as a shared services use case.
Bidders should design their solutions in a way that additional processes can be onboarded rapidly using configuration rather than custom code.
[SR-3] Requirements gathering and refinement in collaboration with MTI stakeholders. Process modelling and design using the proposed BPM platform. Design and implementation of user interfaces for different personas (case workers, supervisors, external users). Configuration of business rules, SLAs, escalations, and routing logic. Integration with existing systems such as document management, email, identity management, and core line-of-business systems. Data migration strategy (where applicable) from legacy systems or spreadsheets. System and integration testing, including performance and security testing. Support during user acceptance testing (UAT).
[SR-4] Provide dashboards and reports for monitoring case volumes, workload distribution, SLA performance, and bottlenecks. Enable business users to create or modify standard reports and dashboards without extensive IT involvement. Provide an audit trail for all key process steps, decisions, and data changes.
[SR-5] Deliver training for system administrators, business power users, and end users. Provide training materials and user guides. Support MTI’s change management activities through workshops, knowledge transfer sessions, and documentation.
[SR-6] Provide a minimum of three (3) years of post go-live support and maintenance, including patching, upgrades, and incident resolution. Define service level agreements (SLAs) for response and resolution times. Provide a clear escalation path and governance model for issue handling and enhancements.
[SR-7] Support for both straight-through processing and human-centric workflows. Dynamic case management, including ad-hoc tasks, attachments, and notes. Configurable workqueues, routing and re-assignment rules, and workload balancing.
[SR-8] Centralised rules management to externalise business policies from application code. Versioning, testing, and controlled deployment of rules. Ability for authorised business users to update certain rules without vendor intervention (under governance).
[SR-9] Web-based, responsive user interfaces accessible via standard browsers. Guided steps and contextual help for case workers. Self-service portals or forms for external users to submit applications and track status.
[SR-10] Definition and monitoring of SLAs and performance targets per process and case type. Automated escalations, notifications, and reminders. Real-time dashboards for supervisors and management.
[SR-11] Based on a proven, enterprise-grade BPM suite suitable for government and large enterprises. Low-code / model-driven configuration approach to minimise custom development. Support for deployment in MTI’s chosen environment (on-premises, cloud, or hybrid), to be specified in the Bidder’s response. High availability and scalability to support growth in users and transaction volumes.
[SR-12] Standard integration mechanisms (e.g., REST APIs, message queues, event-based integration). Secure integration with MTI’s identity management and single sign-on (SSO) infrastructure. Support for integration with existing document management and email systems.
[SR-13] Role-based access control with fine-grained permissions. Full audit logging of key user actions and process changes. Compliance with relevant national data protection and cybersecurity regulations. Environment separation for development, testing, and production.
[SR-14] Bidders must demonstrate: At least three (3) years of experience in implementing the proposed BPM platform. At least two (2) similar projects for government or large enterprises, preferably in trade, economic development, or related domains. Availability of certified consultants on the proposed platform (architects, developers, and business analysts). A strong local presence or partnership to ensure smooth implementation and support. Bidders must provide customer references, including project scope, duration, and outcomes.

RESPONSE STRUCTURE REQUIREMENTS (How to respond):
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[RSR-1] Bidders shall structure their proposals as follows:
1. Executive Summary.
2. Understanding of MTI’s Objectives and Context.
3. Proposed Solution Overview (architecture, major components, key differentiators).
4. Implementation Approach and Methodology.
5. Project Plan and Timelines, including major milestones.
6. Proposed Team Structure, roles, and CVs of key personnel.
7. Functional and Technical Compliance Matrix responding to the requirements in Sections 5 and 6.
8. Assumptions, Dependencies, and Risks, with proposed mitigation strategies.
9. Support and Maintenance Model, including SLAs.
10. Commercial Proposal (licensing, implementation services, support, and any optional components).
[RSR-2] All proposals must be submitted in English. Proposals must be provided in both editable format and PDF. Bidders must strictly follow the structure listed above, clearly labelling each section and subsection.
[RSR-3] Proposals must be submitted electronically before the submission deadline. Late submissions may be rejected without further consideration. All questions regarding this RFP must be submitted in writing by the deadline for questions.

EXTRACTION DATA:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Language: en

KEY REQUIREMENTS SUMMARY:
Enterprise BPM Platform Implementation
Unified BPM solution for process automation and case management
Low-code, model-driven configuration with integration to existing systems
Comprehensive functional, technical, and security requirements
Three-year support and maintenance with defined SLAs
Structured proposal format and evaluation based on fit, experience, and cost"}

Enterprise BPM Platform Implementation
Unified BPM platform for process automation and case management
Low-code, model-driven configuration with integration to existing systems
Comprehensive functional, technical, and security requirements
Three-year support and maintenance with defined SLAs
Evaluation based on fit, experience, approach, and total cost of ownership

{"key_requirements_summary": "Enterprise BPM Platform Implementation
Unified BPM platform for process automation and case management
Low-code, model-driven configuration with integration to existing systems
Comprehensive functional, technical, and security requirements
Three-year support and maintenance with defined SLAs
Evaluation based on fit, experience, approach, and total cost of ownership", "language": "en", "removed_text_length": 306, "cleaned_text_excerpt": "MINISTRY OF TRADE AND INDUSTRY (MTI) REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL (RFP) RFP No: MTI/BPM/2024/01 Implementation of an Enterprise Business Process Management (BPM) Platform

1. Introduction
The Ministry of Trade and Industry ("MTI" or "the Ministry") invites qualified vendors ("Bidders") to submit proposals for the supply, implementation, and ongoing support of an enterprise Business Process Management (BPM) platform. The solution will be used to automate, monitor, and continuously improve MTI’s core business processes and related workflows. This RFP outlines the Ministry’s requirements, expectations, and evaluation criteria. Bidders are required to submit comprehensive, well-structured responses in accordance with the instructions provided in this document.

2. Background
MTI is responsible for promoting sustainable economic growth, supporting businesses, facilitating trade, and encouraging investment. The Ministry currently operates multiple legacy systems and a number of manual, paper-based or email-driven processes for case handling, approvals, licensing, grants management, inspections, and stakeholder engagements. These fragmented processes lead to limited end-to-end visibility of cases and workloads, inconsistent application of business rules and policies, longer processing times and delays in decision-making, and high dependency on manual intervention and individual staff knowledge. To address these challenges, MTI intends to implement a modern, model-driven BPM platform with strong capabilities for case management, workflow orchestration, rules management, and integration with existing systems.

3. Objectives
The key objectives of this RFP are to:
- Implement a unified BPM platform to orchestrate and manage core MTI business processes.
- Provide a configurable case management capability that supports both structured and unstructured work.
- Enforce consistent application of business rules, policy, and regulatory requirements.
- Improve transparency and auditability through end-to-end tracking of cases, tasks, and SLAs.
- Enable faster introduction of new services and process changes via low-code configuration.
- Provide user-friendly interfaces for staff, management, and external stakeholders.
- Lay the foundation for analytics and continuous process improvement.

4. Scope of Work
The successful Bidder will be required to deliver, at minimum, the following:

4.1 Solution Provisioning
- Provide an enterprise-grade BPM platform, licensed for MTI’s anticipated user base (internal and external users).
- Support both workbasket and worklist paradigms for task distribution and assignment.
- Provide role-based access control with integration to MTI’s identity management (e.g., Active Directory or equivalent).

4.2 Process Areas in Scope
The initial implementation will focus on, but is not limited to, the following processes:
- Business licensing and renewals.
- Incentive and grants application management.
- Trade facilitation case handling and approvals.
- Internal service requests (e.g., HR, Finance, IT service requests) as a shared services use case.
Bidders should design their solutions in a way that additional processes can be onboarded rapidly using configuration rather than custom code.

4.3 Implementation Services
- Requirements gathering and refinement in collaboration with MTI stakeholders.
- Process modelling and design using the proposed BPM platform.
- Design and implementation of user interfaces for different personas (case workers, supervisors, external users).
- Configuration of business rules, SLAs, escalations, and routing logic.
- Integration with existing systems such as document management, email, identity management, and core line-of-business systems.
- Data migration strategy (where applicable) from legacy systems or spreadsheets.
- System and integration testing, including performance and security testing.
- Support during user acceptance testing (UAT).

4.4 Reporting and Analytics
- Provide dashboards and report"}

Enterprise BPM Platform Implementation
Unified BPM platform for process automation and case management
Low-code, model-driven configuration with integration to existing systems
Comprehensive functional, technical, and security requirements
Three-year support and maintenance with defined SLAs
Structured proposal format and evaluation based on fit, experience, and cost

1. Introduction
The Ministry of Trade and Industry ("MTI" or "the Ministry") invites qualified vendors ("Bidders") to submit proposals for the supply, implementation, and ongoing support of an enterprise Business Process Management (BPM) platform. The solution will be used to automate, monitor, and continuously improve MTI’s core business processes and related workflows. This RFP outlines the Ministry’s requirements, expectations, and evaluation criteria. Bidders are required to submit comprehensive, well-structured responses in accordance with the instructions provided in this document.

2. Background
MTI is responsible for promoting sustainable economic growth, supporting businesses, facilitating trade, and encouraging investment. The Ministry currently operates multiple legacy systems and a number of manual, paper-based or email-driven processes for case handling, approvals, licensing, grants management, inspections, and stakeholder engagements. These fragmented processes lead to limited end-to-end visibility of cases and workloads, inconsistent application of business rules and policies, longer processing times, and high dependency on manual intervention. To address these challenges, MTI intends to implement a modern, model-driven BPM platform with strong capabilities for case management, workflow orchestration, rules management, and integration with existing systems.

3. Objectives
The key objectives of this RFP are to:
- Implement a unified BPM platform to orchestrate and manage core MTI business processes.
- Provide a configurable case management capability that supports both structured and unstructured work.
- Enforce consistent application of business rules, policy, and regulatory requirements.
- Improve transparency and auditability through end-to-end tracking of cases, tasks, and SLAs.
- Enable faster introduction of new services and process changes via low-code configuration.
- Provide user-friendly interfaces for staff, management, and external stakeholders.
- Lay the foundation for analytics and continuous process improvement.

4. Scope of Work
The successful Bidder will be required to deliver, at minimum, the following:

4.1 Solution Provisioning
- Provide an enterprise-grade BPM platform, licensed for MTI’s anticipated user base (internal and external users).
- Support both workbasket and worklist paradigms for task distribution and assignment.
- Provide role-based access control with integration to MTI’s identity management (e.g., Active Directory or equivalent).

4.2 Process Areas in Scope
The initial implementation will focus on, but is not limited to, the following processes:
- Business licensing and renewals.
- Incentive and grants application management.
- Trade facilitation case handling and approvals.
- Internal service requests (e.g., HR, Finance, IT service requests) as a shared services use case.
Bidders should design their solutions in a way that additional processes can be onboarded rapidly using configuration rather than custom code.

4.3 Implementation Services
- Requirements gathering and refinement in collaboration with MTI stakeholders.
- Process modelling and design using the proposed BPM platform.
- Design and implementation of user interfaces for different personas (case workers, supervisors, external users).
- Configuration of business rules, SLAs, escalations, and routing logic.
- Integration with existing systems such as document management, email, identity management, and core line-of-business systems.
- Data migration strategy (where applicable) from legacy systems or spreadsheets.
- System and integration testing, including performance and security testing.
- Support during user acceptance testing (UAT).

4.4 Reporting and Analytics
- Provide dashboards and reports for monitoring case volumes, workload distribution, SLA per"}

{"summary": "RFP build query snapshot", "solution_requirements_summary": "[SR-1] The solution will be used to automate, monitor, and continuously improve MTI’s core business processes and related workflows.
[SR-2] Implement a unified BPM platform to orchestrate and manage core MTI business processes.
[SR-3] Provide a configurable case management capability that supports both structured and unstructured work.
[SR-4] Enforce consistent application of business rules, policy, and regulatory requirements.
[SR-5] Improve transparency and auditability through end-to-end tracking of cases, tasks, and SLAs.
[SR-6] Enable faster introduction of new services and process changes via low-code configuration.
[SR-7] Provide user-friendly interfaces for staff, management, and external stakeholders.
[SR-8] Lay the foundation for analytics and continuous process improvement.
[SR-9] Provide an enterprise-grade BPM platform, licensed for MTI’s anticipated user base (internal and external users).
[SR-10] Support both workbasket and worklist paradigms for task distribution and assignment.
[SR-11] Provide role-based access control with integration to MTI’s identity management (e.g., Active Directory or equivalent).
[SR-12] The initial implementation will focus on, but is not limited to, the following processes:
- Business licensing and renewals.
- Incentive and grants application management.
- Trade facilitation case handling and approvals.
- Internal service requests (e.g., HR, Finance, IT service requests) as a shared services use case.
Bidders should design their solutions in a way that additional processes can be onboarded rapidly using configuration rather than custom code.
[SR-13] Requirements gathering and refinement in collaboration with MTI stakeholders.
[SR-14] Process modelling and design using the proposed BPM platform.
[SR-15] Design and implementation of user interfaces for different personas (case workers, supervisors, external users).
[SR-16] Configuration of business rules, SLAs, escalations, and routing logic.
[SR-17] Integration with existing systems such as document management, email, identity management, and core line-of-business systems.
[SR-18] Data migration strategy (where applicable) from legacy systems or spreadsheets.
[SR-19] System and integration testing, including performance and security testing.
[SR-20] Support during user acceptance testing (UAT).
[SR-21] Provide dashboards and reports for monitoring case volumes, workload distribution, SLA performance, and bottlenecks.
[SR-22] Enable business users to create or modify standard reports and dashboards without extensive IT involvement.
[SR-23] Provide an audit trail for all key process steps, decisions, and data changes.
[SR-24] Deliver training for system administrators, business power users, and end users.
[SR-25] Provide training materials and user guides.
[SR-26] Support MTI’s change management activities through workshops, knowledge transfer sessions, and documentation.
[SR-27] Provide a minimum of three (3) years of post go-live support and maintenance, including patching, upgrades, and incident resolution.
[SR-28] Define service level agreements (SLAs) for response and resolution times.
[SR-29] Provide a clear escalation path and governance model for issue handling and enhancements.
[SR-30] Support for both straight-through processing and human-centric workflows.
Dynamic case management, including ad-hoc tasks, attachments, and notes.
Configurable workqueues, routing and re-assignment rules, and workload balancing.
[SR-31] Centralised rules management to externalise business policies from application code.
Versioning, testing, and controlled deployment of rules.
Ability for authorised business users to update certain rules without vendor intervention (under governance).
[SR-32] Web-based, responsive user interfaces accessible via standard browsers.
Guided steps and contextual help for case workers.
Self-service portals or forms for external users to submit applications and track status.

================================================================================

SOLUTION REQUIREMENTS (What the buyer wants):
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[SR-1] The solution will be used to automate, monitor, and continuously improve MTI’s core business processes and related workflows.
[SR-2] Implement a unified BPM platform to orchestrate and manage core MTI business processes.
[SR-3] Provide a configurable case management capability that supports both structured and unstructured work.
[SR-4] Enforce consistent application of business rules, policy, and regulatory requirements.
[SR-5] Improve transparency and auditability through end-to-end tracking of cases, tasks, and SLAs.
[SR-6] Enable faster introduction of new services and process changes via low-code configuration.
[SR-7] Provide user-friendly interfaces for staff, management, and external stakeholders.
[SR-8] Lay the foundation for analytics and continuous process improvement.
[SR-9] Provide an enterprise-grade BPM platform, licensed for MTI’s anticipated user base (internal and external users).
[SR-10] Support both workbasket and worklist paradigms for task distribution and assignment.
[SR-11] Provide role-based access control with integration to MTI’s identity management (e.g., Active Directory or equivalent).
[SR-12] The initial implementation will focus on, but is not limited to, the following processes:
- Business licensing and renewals.
- Incentive and grants application management.
- Trade facilitation case handling and approvals.
- Internal service requests (e.g., HR, Finance, IT service requests) as a shared services use case.
Bidders should design their solutions in a way that additional processes can be onboarded rapidly using configuration rather than custom code.
[SR-13] Requirements gathering and refinement in collaboration with MTI stakeholders.
[SR-14] Process modelling and design using the proposed BPM platform.
[SR-15] Design and implementation of user interfaces for different personas (case workers, supervisors, external users).
[SR-16] Configuration of business rules, SLAs, escalations, and routing logic.
[SR-17] Integration with existing systems such as document management, email, identity management, and core line-of-business systems.
[SR-18] Data migration strategy (where applicable) from legacy systems or spreadsheets.
[SR-19] System and integration testing, including performance and security testing.
[SR-20] Support during user acceptance testing (UAT).
[SR-21] Provide dashboards and reports for monitoring case volumes, workload distribution, SLA performance, and bottlenecks.
[SR-22] Enable business users to create or modify standard reports and dashboards without extensive IT involvement.
[SR-23] Provide an audit trail for all key process steps, decisions, and data changes.
[SR-24] Deliver training for system administrators, business power users, and end users.
[SR-25] Provide training materials and user guides.
[SR-26] Support MTI’s change management activities through workshops, knowledge transfer sessions, and documentation.
[SR-27] Provide a minimum of three (3) years of post go-live support and maintenance, including patching, upgrades, and incident resolution.
[SR-28] Define service level agreements (SLAs) for response and resolution times.
[SR-29] Provide a clear escalation path and governance model for issue handling and enhancements.
[SR-30] Support for both straight-through processing and human-centric workflows.
Dynamic case management, including ad-hoc tasks, attachments, and notes.
Configurable workqueues, routing and re-assignment rules, and workload balancing.
[SR-31] Centralised rules management to externalise business policies from application code.
Versioning, testing, and controlled deployment of rules.
Ability for authorised business users to update certain rules without vendor intervention (under governance).
[SR-32] Web-based, responsive user interfaces accessible via standard browsers.
Guided steps and contextual help for case workers.
Self-service portals or forms for external users to submit applications and track status.
[SR-33] Definition and monitoring of SLAs and performance targets per process and case type.
Automated escalations, notifications, and reminders.
Real-time dashboards for supervisors and management.
[SR-34] Based on a proven, enterprise-grade BPM suite suitable for government and large enterprises.
Low-code / model-driven configuration approach to minimise custom development.
Support for deployment in MTI’s chosen environment (on-premises, cloud, or hybrid), to be specified in the Bidder’s response.
High availability and scalability to support growth in users and transaction volumes.
[SR-35] Standard integration mechanisms (e.g., REST APIs, message queues, event-based integration).
Secure integration with MTI’s identity management and single sign-on (SSO) infrastructure.
Support for integration with existing document management and email systems.
[SR-36] Role-based access control with fine-grained permissions.
Full audit logging of key user actions and process changes.
Compliance with relevant national data protection and cybersecurity regulations.
Environment separation for development, testing, and production.
[SR-37] Bidders must demonstrate:
- At least three (3) years of experience in implementing the proposed BPM platform.
- At least two (2) similar projects for government or large enterprises, preferably in trade, economic development, or related domains.
- Availability of certified consultants on the proposed platform (architects, developers, and business analysts).
- A strong local presence or partnership to ensure smooth implementation and support.
Bidders must provide customer references, including project scope, duration, and outcomes.

RESPONSE STRUCTURE REQUIREMENTS (How to respond):
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[RSR-1] Bidders shall structure their proposals as follows:
1. Executive Summary.
2. Understanding of MTI’s Objectives and Context.
3. Proposed Solution Overview (architecture, major components, key differentiators).
4. Implementation Approach and Methodology.
5. Project Plan and Timelines, including major milestones.
6. Proposed Team Structure, roles, and CVs of key personnel.
7. Functional and Technical Compliance Matrix responding to the requirements in Sections 5 and 6.
8. Assumptions, Dependencies, and Risks, with proposed mitigation strategies.
9. Support and Maintenance Model, including SLAs.
10. Commercial Proposal (licensing, implementation services, support, and any optional components).
[RSR-2] All proposals must be submitted in English.
Proposals must be provided in both editable format and PDF.
Bidders must strictly follow the structure listed above, clearly labelling each section and subsection.
[RSR-3] Proposals must be submitted electronically via the designated email address with the subject line: "RFP Response MTI/BPM/2024/01".
Bidders must ensure that their complete proposal is received before the submission deadline. Late submissions may be rejected without further consideration.
All questions regarding this RFP must be submitted in writing to the same email address by the deadline for questions.

EXTRACTION DATA:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Language: en

KEY REQUIREMENTS SUMMARY:
Enterprise BPM Platform Implementation
Unified BPM platform for process automation and case management
Low-code, model-driven configuration with integration to existing systems
Comprehensive functional, technical, and security requirements
Three-year support and maintenance with defined SLAs
Structured proposal format and evaluation based on fit, experience, and cost"}
